news.title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
news.summary: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

news.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s “adult mode” reportedly fired on discrimination claim
news.summary: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.

news.title: Okay, now exactly half of xAI’s founding team has left the company
news.summary: Whatever the cause of the departures, the cumulative impact is alarming. There is a lot of work left to do at xAI, and an IPO will bring more scrutiny than the lab has ever faced before.

news.title: Amazon may launch a marketplace where media sites can sell their content to AI companies
news.summary: A new report claims the e-commerce giant is looking to create a pipeline of licensable content between media publishers and AI companies.

news.title: An ice dance duo skated to AI music at the Olympics
news.summary: Czech ice dancers Katerina Mrazkova and Daniel Mrazek are learning the hard way that LLMs sometimes spit out straight-up plagiarism.

news.title: The Toyota Highlander is now a three-row electric SUV with 320 miles of range
news.summary: Toyota unveiled the new 2027 Highlander, a fully redesigned midsize SUV that marks the brand's first three-row electric vehicle for the US market and the first Toyota EV assembled in America. news.title: Amazon Ring’s Super Bowl ad sparks backlash amid fears of mass surveillance
news.summary: Ring's new Search Party feature has once again drawn backlash for the company. A 30-second ad that aired during Sunday's Super Bowl showed Ring cameras "surveilling" neighborhoods to locate a lost dog. news.title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp Recorded a Video About ICE for His Employees
